content.question:
Let random variable <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of employees who work at a certain restaurant on a given day. The following table shows the probability distribution of the random variable <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Number of Employees 

Probability 

20 
0.1 

21 
0.1 

22 
0.1 

23 
0.4 

24 
0.3 

Which of the following claims is best supported by the table?

choices.label: The most likely number of employees who work on a given day is 24.
The mean number of employees who work on a given day is equal to the median number of employees who work on a given day.
The mean number of employees who work on a given day is greater than the median number of employees who work on a given day.
The mean number of employees who work on a given day is less than the median number of employees who work on a given day.
On a given day, the number of employees who work at the restaurant occurs with equal probabilities.

content.answer: The mean number of employees who work on a given day is less than the median number of employees who work on a given day.

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

topic.text: 4.7: Introduction to Random Variables and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
